meanings.sent1: Playing in the mud becrimes my clothes.
meanings.sent2: The spilled juice becrimes the white tablecloth.
meanings.sent3: Oops, I accidentally becrimed my shirt with paint.
meanings.sent4: The rain becrimes the city streets with mud.
meanings.sent5: The naughty puppy becrimes the carpet with muddy paw prints.

meanings.definition: To accuse or charge with a crime
meanings.sent1: The detective becrimes the suspect of theft.
meanings.sent2: The prosecutor becrimes the defendant of murder.
meanings.sent3: In the game of Clue, players becrime each other with funny accusations.
meanings.sent4: The villain becrimes the hero with a false crime.
meanings.sent5: The judge becrimes the criminal with a harsh sentence.
